GitHub

Designing for the web with vega-lite & Altair & Streamlit

Using Altair create interactive visualizations in Python and an introduction to Streamlit.

NOTE: For Python, only a subset of libraries are supported. See ongoing list here.

Optional reading list

  1. vega-lite docs
  2. Altair docs - in particular Encoding Data Types, Vegalite-Altair conversions, Binning, Filter transforms and interactive examples
  3. FDV, Ch. 5: Directory of visualizations

Extra Resources

  • FiveThirtyEight
  • FiveThirtyEight datasets
  • jsdelivr
  • vega-datasets

Data

Vega Unemployment Data

US Unemployment Data

The Mobility dataset (online)

A dataset of USA "mobility" which (I think comes from a a large census study from 1989-2015) and is collected in several places including right here. Here "mobility" is referring to how easy it is for a person to move up in economic status (more info can be found here) based on factors like parental income, location, race, etc.

This course developed collaboratively by Jill Naiman and Matthew Turk at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign School of Information Sciences. The source code is released under a BSD 3-Clause license, allowing for reuse and redistribution.
